intro: Chromatotriccum rhabdoglossum, commonly known as the red-tongued liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. The plant has a thalloid structure with a prostrate, leafy stem and is characterized by its distinctive red-tinged leaves. It is often found in temperate regions and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
